answers.D: Only when the tower exceeds 30 feet in height

T0B07.question: Which of the following is an important safety rule to remember when using a crank-up tower?

answers.A: This type of tower must never be painted
answers.C: This type of tower must never be climbed unless it is in the fully retracted position
answers.B: This type of tower must never be grounded
answers.D: All of these choices are correct

T0B06.question: What is the minimum safe distance from a power line to allow when installing an antenna?

answers.A: Half the width of your property
answers.B: The height of the power line above ground
answers.D: So that if the antenna falls unexpectedly, no part of it can come closer than 10 feet to the power wires

T7B08.question: What should you do if something in a neighbor's home is causing harmful interference to your amateur station?

answers.A: Work with your neighbor to identify the offending device
answers.C: Check your station and make sure it meets the standards of good amateur practice
answers.B: Politely inform your neighbor about the rules that prohibit the use of devices which cause interference
answers.D: All of these choices are correct

answers.A: An unlicensed device that may emit low powered radio signals on frequencies used by a licensed service
answers.C: A device for long distance communications using special codes sanctioned by the International Amateur Radio Union
answers.B: A type of amateur radio that can legally be used in the citizen's band
answers.D: A type of test set used to determine whether a transmitter is in compliance with FCC regulation 91.15

T7B06.question: Which of the following actions should you take if a neighbor tells you that your station's transmissions are interfering with their radio or TV reception?

answers.A: Make sure that your station is functioning properly and that it does not cause interference to your own radio or television when it is tuned to the same channel
answers.C: Tell them that your license gives you the right to transmit and nothing can be done to reduce the interference
answers.B: Immediately turn off your transmitter and contact the nearest FCC office for assistance
answers.D: Install a harmonic doubler on the output of your transmitter and tune it until the interference is eliminated

T7B07.question: Which of the following may be useful in correcting a radio frequency interference problem?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct

T7B04.question: Which of the following is a way to reduce or eliminate interference by an amateur transmitter to a nearby telephone?

answers.A: Put a filter on the amateur transmitter
answers.C: Reduce the SWR on the transmitter transmission line
answers.D: Put a RF filter on the telephone

T7B05.question: How can overload of a non-amateur radio or TV receiver by an amateur signal be reduced or eliminated?

answers.A: Block the amateur signal with a filter at the antenna input of the affected receiver
answers.C: Switch the transmitter from FM to SSB
answers.B: Block the interfering signal with a filter on the amateur transmitter
answers.D: Switch the transmitter to a narrow-band mode

T7B02.question: What would cause a broadcast AM or FM radio to receive an amateur radio transmission unintentionally?

answers.A: The receiver is unable to reject strong signals outside the AM or FM band
answers.C: The audio amplifier of the transmitter is overloaded
answers.B: The microphone gain of the transmitter is turned up too high
answers.D: The deviation of an FM transmitter is set too low

T7B03.question: Which of the following may be a cause of radio frequency interference?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct

T7B01.question: What can you do if you are told your FM handheld or mobile transceiver is over-deviating?
